title: Excellent care
body: Thank you for your care and attention during my recent appointment . The reception staff were very professional and the GP very thorough

title: Fantastic care
body:
I had an appointment for a pacemaker box change today and from stepping onto the ward, through the procedure and discharge it was obvious all the staff cared about my wellbeing.
 Professional, kind and caring everyone of them.
A very big thank you to you all.

readBy.name: South Tyneside and Sunderland NHS Foundation Trust

title: Quality of care
body: I have had 2tkr and I have been treated with 1st class treatment and care staff on maplin ward are the best

title: Caring professional kind
body: Thank you so much for my asthma review. You were so kind and listened to me. A full asthma plan was put in place and a review booked. You were so caring kind and very professional

title: Covid vaccination
body: Had my first vaccination at Thornbury Health Centre. It was very well organised, I felt extremely safe and the staff where lovely. Well done guys keep up the good work.

title: They share your concerns
body: Fast service very friendly and they care for your health .they are very reliable and never missed a prescription for my regular medication

title: Outstanding
body:
The ladies working in gynaecology gave me outstanding service today. 
So very kind, friendly, warm, supportive, assuring and with humour. 
I was very nervous and they held my hand and supported me throughout. 
I am so grateful to these women and would like to pass on my warmest regards.

title: Ultra Competent Doctors and Midwives
body: We used Queen Elizabeth Hospitals Maternity service for my wife and I can’t speak more highly of the phenomenal team of Doctors and Midwives. Extremely professional ,experienced,  competent and very people focused team. Loved the experience and never felt a moment of panic or uncertainty in what was an important but challenging personal milestone. Also hats off to their dedication for patients during the uncertainty of COVID and the addition complexity and volumes that brings.

title: Brilliant service
body: Came into A&E Monday 8th March by ambulance they were brilliant . The staff at the hospital were brilliant they couldn't do enough for me especially the man in charge who was looking after me. I  had bloods a drip ,chest xray ,ecg ,antibiotics and was monitored all the time i was in there. I went home with my mind at rest as he explained  everything they found with bloods and my chest x-ray. I couldn't thank him enough I will need follow up's  at the QE so hopefully Will be sorted. I can not praise the staff and the Dr enough that  put me at ease .

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Very good practice
body: I received very good care and attention,gp appeared to be interested in my overall health. Very friendly and informative.

title: Amazing
body: Took my little boy with a broken finger. X ray was great very kind and even answered my son's questions about the equipment. Minor injuries were amazing very gentle and kind. PPE was 10/10 and we were there for literally 15 minutes. Very thankful for the service

readBy.name: Mid Cheshire Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great visit
body: Was very happy with the treatment received at the surgery today the nurse and the doctor were very knowledgeable I was treated with the upmost respect

title: Great work
body: Just like to say the staff an carers on ward 29 were amazing looking after me,Got took in with pains got kept in for 4 nights couldnt do enough for me cysts on my ovaries burst ,Also the doctors who done there rounds cleaners the girls who done bloods hope i havnt missed anyone out fantastic ward thankyou so much pat on your backs for all your hard work you do

readBy.name: Liverpool University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: FELT LIKE AN INDIVIDUAL
body:
Felt straight at ease when met at the door, nice clean shinny unit, calm and peaceful. The staff made me feel like I was the only one that mattered although there were others, took their time to explain everything which made me feel reassured. Nothing came as a shock as it had been explained, they gave me garments to maintain my dignity throughout the process. I met the consultant before had who listened to past history before conducting the colonoscopy, they gave me medication so I was able to watch on the screen but didn't feel anything.
To sum it up this experience was like a private hospital ! With tea and biscuits afterwards. Pain free during recovery and at home. Thank you all so much.

title: Very caring
body:
This surgery has always been kind and considerate to mine and my family needs. The doctor visited even visited my father at home and took his bloods when he was not well. We have always been able  book a same day appointment if urgent and this has provided peace of mind especially as I am a first time mum. 

Thank you to you all for continuing to accept me, even though i had moved to another area many years ago.  This made it easier and less stressful for me to bring in my late father, who lived in your area, and my daughter . 
However, since the passing of my father, it is time that I moved to a GP nearer to my house. Thank you, I will always have fond memories of this surgery .   Take care.

title: Good quality of care
body:
The people I spoke to were extremely good.

Provided me with recommendations of audiobooks and websites.

Would highly recommend. Only downfall is the waiting time to get the therapy, but that isn’t their fault.

readBy.name: Hertfordshire Partnership University NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great service
body: Just been for my covid 19 vaccine,  everyone was very helpful and welcoming and the people in carpark,  brilliant work in the rain

title: Disappointed
body: This gp says to book an appointment you need to call @8 when you call at 8 it says call at 8:30. I call at 8:30 or even just 8:35 so the line is less busy and NEVER get a response this is so bad because it’s been on going that I’ve called and no one has picked. Not even a auto message telling you where you are in the Q. I’ve tried to test it out and ended up being on the line for 2 hours and some days when I do call the line just cuts off. They really need to work on this cause I’ve had an ongoing infection which I need help to get treated.

title: Unhelpful
body: Been trying to book an appointment for 5 days straight calling for over 45mins every time, mostly with no answer on the one occassion the phone was answered was told there was nothing they could do only suggestion was to keep calling at 8am everyday as no appointments, wasn't asked about my reason for wanting an appointment when i asked if there was an alternative was told be patient it has taken others weeks before they get one. Appauled at staff responses and lack of engagement. God forbid i have an issue that if left for weeks could potentially change from minor to life threatening. I don't understand why apointments can no longer be made in advance with checks for Covid closer to the date?! rather than a 8 am ten min window to get an appointment daily. I work at GWH with the NHS and this surgery has been a shambles in its management im sad to say.

title: Poor service
body: I have just rang to book a blood test that I need. I waited on hold in the queue for 20 mins plus. I asked If I could book my brother’s covid vaccine, she said he’s not registered and to try elsewhere. Then she hung up. I never got to ask about me. I dialled again and am now 8th in the queue!! Ridiculous. If I’d known I only got 1 question I’d have booked the blood test first. Terrible service!

title: Unprofessional and Rude
body: After being discharged from hospital following surgery yesterday, i needed to make a 4 week check up appointment with my GP. I called reception to book but was told there are no appointments in the time i needed to be checked. I was then told it would be over the phone so the GP wouldn't be able to check me anyway so there was no point. I was calm and polite the entire call but when i questioned why i couldn't have a face to face appointment to be checked by a GP she put the phone down. Will be changing surgeries. Waste of time.

title: Stay away
body:
Honestly if you’re new to the area, just don’t even bother with this doctors surgery. 
You probably better off not having a GP.
Staff don’t want to answer the phone, It’s been so bad sometimes that I’ve been waiting for 20+ minutes, then got in my car, driven there to find staff just chatting meanwhile my call is still waiting to be answered. Had a call in December with a nurse, who was incredible rude, just spoke over me the entire phone call, I barely said a sentence, prescribed me something that had nothing to do with the reason I called. This is the kind of GP practice that you just learn to live with you problem because it is pure hassle trying to deal with these people, and that’s exactly what I’ve done in this case.  Despite selecting a chemist, my prescription is sent to a different one everytime, doctors/nurses claim prescription will be ready in around 3 days, but realistically it’s about 7 if youre lucky, even then your standing outside the chemist on the phone to the doctors asking them why is hasn’t been sent over, so then you have to wait for a doctor to respond to a urgent message the receptionist sends them, so they can quickly sort it out. 
Zero communication between staff and patients, ordered a repeat prescription for the pill about 10 days before I was due to run out, all seemed fine advised should be ready in 3 days, prescription wasn’t ready after about 5 days, so rung the practice who then informed me I needed a pill check but couldnt get me in for at least a week. No one even thought to call to say I needed this check! Another time I was advised by a nurse she would get the reception to call to arrange an appointment with a doctor, heard nothing, rung the practice and they had booked an appointment for 3 weeks time and didn’t even let me know! 

It’s shocking the reviews on here are favourable to the practice. So I urge you to check out places people are more likely to leave reviews. For example google.  
A recent inspection quoted that the patient satisfaction had risen, I have no idea where that has come from considering I been a patient at this surgery for 20 years and not once been asked about my experience here! If questionnaires were given out in waiting rooms, then these people were just relieved they actually managed to get an appointment. 
Considering I only use my GP for repeat pill prescription and very rarely for anything else it speaks volumes that I have had so many problems with this surgery.

title: Great organisation for Coronavirus vaccine…
body: I was 30 minutes early thinking I might be queuing.  Got to the surgery, all well organised with one-way system, masks, sanitiser and organisation.  I was taken in immediately, asked relevant questions, got temperature check and jab in about 8 minutes - done 20 minutes ahead of my appointment time!  Wonderful service, friendly, professional staff.  My wife is upset because I got a badge and she didn't... LOL!  Well done to all at this surgery - and well done NHS.

author: Marthyjon
title: Ward 53- my papa
body:
My Papa got admitted to ward 53 with COVID 19. Whilst being on the ward he received good care and got quickly got discharged home to be with my Nana.  
He got great care by the doctors who quickly noticed why his blood sugars where high and sorted the issue. Papa enjoyed the meals and many cups of tea he got and enjoyed the ward area as he was in a room with 5 other patients so he felt like he had lots of company.  
Our only improvement would be that it was hard to get through to the ward and my Papa was left to update the family. Nana and Papa were thankful for the 'angel nurse' Maisy that gave helpful updates and advice to my Nana on the day Papa got discharged.  
Thank you to ward 53 for helping my Papa get home safely!

title: Bad practice
body: Phoned to speak to doctor today 9 March. Because I couldn't  move my shoulder receptionist was very rude to me and told me to phone back next week for appointment or phone back tomorrow morning at 8.00.  I phoned two weeks ago with my depression and got the same answer and I had suicidal feelings.

author: Boiley
title: Emergency contact number
body: After treatment at the Head and Neck treatment room, I was given a leaflet "Discharge Information". It gave two numbers in case I had any questions or concerns but these are actually ward numbers and I was unable to obtain the help required. I was given an ENT Emergency Clinic number by the doctor treating me, but this was hardly ever answered. On one day I rang it over 5 times and it was clear that there was no one there to answer it at all. It appears to be impossible to contact ENT/Head and Neck for substantial periods of time.

author: Joker6364
title: Cataract surgery
body:
Had my left eye sorted in mid December. Was offered general anaesthetic as I’m such a lightweight when it comes to people poking my eyes (it’s why I have never been able to wear contacts). Despite all the extra COVID precautions I was in and out in under 8 hours even after general. Absolutely straightforward and pain free. The hardest bit for me was getting the wee pellet under my lower eyelid. The staff could not have been more reassuring. I took eye drops for 2 weeks after and apart from a wee bit of stickiness for a few days my left eye made full recovery. I can honestly say as an older male getting my eye sorted has been life changing. I can now drive without glasses (and walk round Tesco fully masked without specs). I still need to wear cheap reading glasses for close up work. Next year I get my right eye done.  
Thank you Hairmyres and thank you NHS Scotland.

author: FV89
title: Out of hours doctor being extremely rude
body:
I had my vaccination a few days ago and have had a reaction to it causing me to barely be able to move my arm. I phoned NHS 24 and they referred me to my local health service and when I was called back, I spoke to the rudest doctor I have ever had to deal with.  
After my Covid vaccination, I was wiped out but in a lot of pain with my arm. Around the injection site had become inflamed and hot with a bump and a lot of pain. It’s been very difficult to sleep on or do anything with. I phoned looking for help and advice from a doctor and explained how the paracetamol I had been told to take was not doing anything. I felt that the doctor then spoke down to me, telling me that everyone has different reactions to vaccines, how they weren't concerned about my arm, how they wouldn’t do anything and how I would just be wasting their time if I went to see them about it. When I coughed, they accused me of laughing at them and got even ruder, saying if I was just going to laugh at them then there’s not point. In the end, after having spent 5 minutes being insulted and spoken down to, I told them that instead of being spoken to like that, that I would phone my GP in the morning instead. And their response was just fine, do what you want.  
I understand we should be supporting the NHS. But when doctors think that it is acceptable to speak to a patient like this, what is meant to happen? The doctors are to be treated with respect yet this doctor, whose name I did not catch, did not treat me with respect and was quite happy to interrupt me, talk down to me and be extremely rude to me when I was looking for some help.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: grim
title: Infusions for my crohns
body:
I go to South Tyrone hospital every 8 weeks for infusions. The hospital is so clean and you feel so at ease, the staff are extremely good as you are looked about all the time.  
From nurses to the tea lady, i think the job they do is excellent and I always feel safe when I come for my infusions, at South Tyrone hospital, Dungannon.  
Only negative I have is car parking facilities, but I have no complaints inside with PPE or anything. PPE 10/10, Staff 10/10, Cleanliness 10/10

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Healthvillagepatient
title: Contraception
body:
I attended Aberdeen Health Village to have my contraceptive implant removed. Unfortunately I am allergic to steristrips and there was not an alternative option available to close the wound.  
The nurse did a fantastic job making as small a wound as possible to prevent a scar. She took time to ensure it was as neat as possible and my scar is healing beautifully.  
Hugely appreciated, thank you

author: FPE
title: ASD - TalkAbility (Hanen Program)
body:
I was informed that my 5 years old son (who has got ASD and attends P1) and I will have to wait until the end of the year to attend Talk Ability Program. He really needs help to communicate appropriately with his peers. In other countries Talkability can be delivered through Telepractice but for some reason this is not in place in the U.K. and they only deliver TalkAbility in person. Parents who have kids with autism are desperate to be taught strategies that help their children to communicate and reach their full potential.  
It is completely unacceptable someone to have wait for 9 months or a year to attend such a crucial program.  
I had to buy the TalkAbility book (which costs £48 by the way..) so I get some ideas from it hopefully.  
Unfortunately I will have to wait for months until I will be called to attend the seminar when it is available.

readBy.name: Royal College of Speech and Language Therapists (RCSLT)

author: cheetahzh83
title: Cardiac Care.
body:
After having chest pain and calling my GP and 111, I was admitted to the cardiac ward 2a of Wycombe hospital within an hour.  
The following day I had an angioplasty and a stent fitted.. After a weekend in hospital I had further stents fitted and was discharged having spent a few nights in hospital.  
I am now on a cardiac rehabilitation programme.  
During the whole process, from my talk with my GP (Highfield Surgery, Hazlemere) the arrival of paramedics within 5 mins, my care at Wycombe Hospital, I was treated with the utmost care. Clearly my welfare was paramount. What struck me the most was the care I was given on Ward 2a despite the calls on the nurses looking after more "difficult" patients.  
Five stars to the NHS!

readBy.name: Royal Brompton and Harefield NHS Foundation Trust
Steve Baker's Office, MP for Wycombe

author: lynxzj49
title: Debt of gratitude
body:
May I take the opportunity to say how much I have been depending on this service for the past few years.Without exception , each member of the team has been highly professional , most supportive and encouraging.  
I can depend on the team to respond immediately if I get a chest or lung infection. Recently,they have contacted the GP surgery , had proper medication prescribed , the script left with the pharmacist and the first tablets to be taken within hours.This has meant so much to us as we are both in strict quarantine due to Covid restrictions.Various members of the team have checked up on the medication,instructed and supervised exercises and generally remained very willing to help with advice.We owe them a great debt of gratitude.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: skyej45
title: The service, care and treatment I received
body:
I had to have a procedure on my head where a lump was removed. The doctors and nursing staff were very caring and made the process less worrying from the beginning. Post op I had some concerns and was able to contact the department and discuss these. This was very important as I was then able to have someone see me very quickly. Their expertise made me feel a lot more comfortable than if I was to go to my GP who had no direct link to my case.  
It has been over a month now since the procedure and I have ,when worried about the healing process , been able to contact the nursing staff to discuss my concerns. I have been offered appointments ahead of when I was due to return which again has helped greatly.  
The care and service that all the staff have provided has been wonderful and I feel has helped having the continuity of being able to return to the clinic rather than a my GP.

author: SRCM
title: Gynaecology and endometriosis
body:
I would like to give my thanks to Dr Buck and her team at Crosshouse Hospital gynaecology department. I have been a patient of hers since December 2019 and throughout the pandemic. Firstly, Dr Buck is one of the most caring doctors I have every met. She listened to me and found the root of my problems after I had been dismissed by so many before.  
She has a very caring and calming demeanor and happily answered all the questions I had throughout my care with her. I tend to get myself worked up around medical appointments but she always put my mind at ease. I was also always kept informed about every aspect of my care which made me feel included in the care I received and that I had a voice that mattered. She is very thorough in her work and had no issue referring me to departments that she felt I needed. All the staff that work with her that I met at appointments and my time as an inpatient where extremely supportive and a real credit to the department. It was also always easy to get in touch with her secretary, Mandy, who was always so helpful and kind whenever I called. I felt completely safe in Dr Bucks care and I am forever grateful to her and her team for all the care and support that I have received. They are all a real asset to the department and hospital.

author: Lucymil92
title: We felt safe and cared for at all times
body:
Last week, we gave birth to our gorgeous son, this is our first baby and the care, compassion, professionalism and expertise of all of the staff on both labour ward and ward 16 ensured we felt safe and cared for at all times.  
From our early experiences of coming in for monitoring, through to the labour and post natal care- everything was absolutely faultless. We experienced emergency surgery post birth and all of the team acted quickly and made a really traumatic situation as calm as possible.  
We would like to highlight some of the staff we had direct dealings with-  
Eunice and Claire - filled us with confidence and reassurance throughout labour and made the experience as special as possible for us.  
Mariette and Roma- offered unwavering support and kindness, I have no doubt both will continue to be exceptional midwives once fully qualified.  
Many more of the team were critical in supporting us including the Dr who stepped in when things went wrong, unfortunately I didn’t catch her name.  
Susie, Anne, Inka, Lucy and Annika - gave us reassurance when we needed it, offered humour and friendly advice throughout learning to feed, recovery and getting to know our new baby.  
All of the staff we encountered were an absolute asset to the NHS and the BGH and we cannot begin to thank them enough for everything they done for us. Their care, compassion and kindness as well as professional expertise and knowledge should be celebrated and we are indebted to them for ensuring that an emergency situation did not detract from the most special moment of our lives.

author: Becks237
title: Covid 19 Vaccination deaf aware
body: I got my vaccine yesterday and I was happy with service I got as I can’t lipread with a face mask on as I’m hard of hearing/deaf. One of the staff knew me when saw my name on the card and came over and spoke to me. As I wouldn’t be able to understand the questions being ask when the staff was at the computer. Need to be more aware for access for deaf people who can’t hear or lip reading lips while face mask being worned. If you had signs etc to be clear what you want us to do or what being asked.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: Wor69
title: Excellent care from GP
body:
My elderly father fell, and has injured his face, hand and side. He contacted his GP from his Medical Practice who phoned him back, and arranged to see him within an hour of the phone call. After seeing him, they arranged for him to have X rays performed at the local hospital and is referring him to the falls service.  
My dad has had a few health concerns over the last year or so, and the staff at the Practice including the GPs and practice nurse have been very kind and supportive to them. I live at a bit of a distance from them and it is hugely reassuring that they have this support.

author: Springsun
title: Covid Vaccination
body: I queued for an hour after my vaccination time, most of that standing indoors in a hall with about 60 people all standing on spaced yellow circles but with plenty of aerosol opportunity for spread of infection. If we are to queue it would be better to let people wait outside. There was no concern expressed at the long wait in a space with many people which gave me the impression that perhaps no effort would be made to improve the situation.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Curefan
title: My anxiety
body: I have had depression for several years which has never really gone away, and I am still on the waiting list after several weeks / months of having been referred.   But what I do like is the fact that although I still haven't started receiving treatment yet, the service called Back on Track, who will be giving me the treatment, are putting me forward for workshops they run in the meantime, so that at least in the meantime, I have something to work with that will help me get through these times until I start receiving psychology treatment.

author: eaglezg54
title: Well done team
body:
I just wanted to get in touch about my experience as an out patient today at Glasgow Royal infirmary.  
I was seen today for a CT scan with contrast and was particularly nervous.  
I wasn't sure where I was to go as my letter wasn't very clear and asked a member of staff at the front desk who was very prompt and provided easy instructions where to go to.  
When I arrived at the dept I was dealt with immediately and taken through to prepare for my scan. Each member of staff I encountered today was extremely pleasant and professional and put me at ease from the admin staff to the cardiac doctors and radiographers and nurses.  
Given the exceptional circumstances that they are operating in at the moment I just wanted to share my positive experience.  
A massive well done to all your team.  
Thankyou.

author: aquariustm59
title: My elderly dad’s treatment.
body:
Dad’s GP did an urgent referral to Dermatology as he had a bleeding, painful growth on the back of his ear. The Dr explained that it was skin cancer & due to the area of coverage, a referral to a Plastic surgeon would be needed. We saw Mr Rahman & his Reg. in Clinic A who were both extremely helpful. The HCSW was extremely helpful, her name is Clara & she couldn’t do enough to help us. Dad then attended as a day case to have the growth removed & again all the nurses were so kind & helpful. Unfortunately, I only got one nurses name, Caroline, who so kindly made dad a cup of tea after surgery, served with lots of biscuits! Dad then had to attend Plastic surgery dressings clinic and, again, all staff were extremely kind & helpful. The nurse in the clinic was Amanda who was very kind. Dad & I were both humbled by the very kind & thoughtful student nurse also working in the clinic, whose name I didn’t get but, she was lovely.  
All of these events took place in just a few weeks & dad & I are both very appreciative & grateful. Especially at this time when the NHS is working very hard.  
We are awaiting the biopsy results now & fingers crossed no further treatment is needed!  
Thank you everyone!

readBy.name: MASScot- Melanoma Action and Support Scotland

author: Fairy2101
title: Early Pregnancy Unit
body:
I felt very dismissed by the midwives when I saw them.  
The uncertainty of it all is something that concerns me.... how can you leave someone in the lurch like that ?  
To be told they “couldn’t be sure” if I’m pregnant or had a miscarriage... then to have my bloods come back as less than 1HCG but I still have positive urine tests.  
They pretty much discharged me after this, fobbing me off, when I felt they should be doing bloods to see if it’s rising.  
So disappointed.

author: AS21
title: Two doses of Covid-19 vaccine
body: I work as a doctor and I got my two doses of the vaccine, 12 weeks apart. The way the vaccination centre works is very efficient. I took both doses and felt absolutely fine with it. I had sore arm for a day, that’s it. I would recommend everyone to take the vaccination.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: septembercx43
title: Vaccinations
body: Last Wednesday my mother attended the allergy clinic set up to deliver the Covid Vaccination in CAH.   The staff were fabulous.   Olivia and Rebecca made my mother feel welcome and safe and helped to relax and calm any nerves about the vaccination.   The whole process was seamless and reassuring.   We just wanted to say a big thank you to them all in the allergy clinic set up to administer the vaccinations on a job well done.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Stewart Family
title: Good communication with loved ones is so important during COVID visiting restrictions
body:
Our 87 y. o mother was recently admitted to Craigavon Area Hospital. Initially admitted following vomiting of old blood that quickly progressed to complete kidney failure. The staff in ED were calm and thorough in assessing mum, importantly allowing us to tell them how well she normally is with good health and high quality of life for her years. Thanks to Dr Nicholl and Sr Jill For their professional reassurance she was in safe hands. Sent to theatre that evening special shout out to the night nurses in ED Amy and Ashley who kept in contact to let us know how she was.  
After a scary post procedure period, off to ward 1 South. Again the nurses made calls on most days to provide updates. This is so so important as it it near on impossible to get through to the ward. She is home now and our family grateful for the care she received. All the nursing staff and physios on ward 1 south were great. With special mention to SN Alaina ( hope that spelling is right) who contacted us regularly and her kindness in her voice as well as her actions. Mum says all the nurses were very good and the soup ( ‘second to none’) that helped her recovery. Please thank the catering staff. Very special mention to Dr Baird who managed mums kidney function, kept a close eye and kept us up to date with progress. Also diabetes nurse special Rachel who provided us with virtual training for mums new insulin regime at home.  
The key thread in this review is the critical role that regular updates play in building trust and putting families at ease during what is a very anxious time for families when loved ones are in hospital and you can’t visit. Even at times when there is nothing new to report - that’s ok it still has value for the family, still make contact just to say no change. Days with no contact are anxious days and I imagine this is especially so if loved ones are not on the recovery journey.  
At 87 it was mums first admission to hospital and she would like us to thank everyone involved in her care and while the soup was terrific she hopes not to be tasting it again too soon! Thank you on behalf of our family for building her up and returning her to us so we can enjoy more precious times at home.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Yorkshire & Humber Patient Safety Research Collaboration

author: Janejeff
title: Outstanding care
body: I was recently admitted to be induced at 38 weeks the midwife that looked after me was outstanding her name was Rachel. From how she looked after me at the time I was induced and after having baby and being on the ward for 2 days, her care was outstanding from how she helped me with feeding baby to looking after me the girl deserved a medal. Can tell she loves her job shes based on ward 31 a and 31b maternity as much as she was amazing the whole ward can't fall they maternity department really do deserve they were all amazing the midwifes the care assistants that department do not get enough credit my care was amazing xxx

author: golfsd36
title: Covid vaccine
body: All the staff at the vaccine clinic in Craigavon south lake leisure centre were very warm and welcoming and made me feel very comfortable! Thanks so much for such a smooth operation and making the vaccine roll out happen. Mary was very clear and easy to understand when she went through the questions and gave me my jab. Feel very thankful

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Debs_
title: Covid Vaccination
body: A nurse called me this afternoon and offered a vaccine today. I was pleased. It's all been very organised, a good experience and I would not have changed anything.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: Sunshine_
title: Covid Vaccination
body: I work in the NHS and filled in a form. I was phoned a week ago about this vacancy, it was very easy. No waiting time. I was guided by the volunteer and it was all very straight forward. I was given all the info about possible side effects and I didn't need to ask any questions.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: liberatorxg46
title: The team were fantastic
body: I went into Hairmyers for a aortic aneurysm which was carried out by Mr Vessel and his team who were fantastic and wards 4/5 12 who looked after me great. Thanks to Mr vessel I am still here they cannot get enough praise so please pass on my thanks to all.

author: thubanmh45
title: Birth of my first baby
body:
In February, our beautiful baby boy arrived safely at Daisy Hill Hospital. This would have been impossible without the great help and support of staff at the Delivery Suite and Maternity Ward. I could not have done this without you guys. Many many thanks to amazing Midwives Aishling, Arlene, Fiona and Karen at the Delivery Suite who were beyond incredible. They were supporting me right from the start of my active labour, comforting me and providing with motivational guidance. A very special thanks goes to Karen - Student Midwife whom I will never forget and cherish forever for being right beside me holding my hand, comforting me, re-assuring me and being extremely caring.  
Right from the start from when I got admitted through to safe arrival and discharge of my baby, staff members Maeve, Joanne, Grainne, Imelda and Siobhan at the Maternity Ward, were incredibly patient, very supportive and caring. Also many thanks to Myra and the team who provided me with great care during my Antenatal appointments.  
All of you guys mentioned above have a very special place in my heart and truly are the very best. You guys are super!  
Overall, for a person who even gets scared of just an injection, the support that all these staff members gave me was truly fantastic. Words can't express the gratitude we have for all of you ❤.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Renya
title: Weight and Chronic Pain Management
body:
As a woman with three children, it has always been important to me that I am able to successfully be a part of their lives. I suffer from several prolapsed discs (neuropathy, mobility and cognitive impairment), there has been no referral regarding MS or any other conditions and I have pain managed via Gabapentin. It's not ideal, as it really only masks the symptoms.  
Part of this is potentially due to the fact that I am classed as morbidly obese. At 5'11 (roughly, damage to discs may have altered this) and 25 stone (ish) I've never been at an ideal weight. Any time I seek help, my weight is mentioned. Ever single time. Including the most recent conversation via a phone call to the pain clinic, whose final assessment was to lose weight and continue taking medication. As you may imagine for me this is disheartening, depressing and frankly, useless.  
The idea that weight loss has never been attempted or even addressed in my opinion is insulting and reminds me of the stereotypes of those who are overweight. Not to mention the inherent judgment that I feel appears to proceed with all conversations even before I've begun to speak. While perhaps not truly a cultural problem it is a stigma that persists wherever I go - and not solely for myself but others as well.  
Over time, I have attempted calorie-controlled diets, restricted plans, and other well known diet plans. These were successful but not for the long-term as a permanent solution, given the process involves not eating until you approach your ideal weight - which, again, I have never been at any point in my life, excepting potentially early childhood.  
With a family history of the same, along with a heritage that files me under the high-risk factors associated with type 2 diabetes, being overweight, my age, and also that I have black Caribbean heritage, all increase my concerns. Sadly, for some reason, I do not qualify for any help with respect to surgical options which I have been informed are my only remaining choice. Nor do I have access to the kinds of money that will allow me to access it privately.  
As one of those who fall into the category of failing to be quite 'sick' enough, it is a difficult decision to believe could ever be acceptable. I feel it would be better to offer me help now, before further conditions, which cost millions - according to the recent data reported across the NHS - to treat and manage, or even to provide the means of a way for those like myself to fund that treatment with some financial help. Being able to support the NHS is not a problem for me but at the moment I need something of the same kind of support and consideration in return.  
So, can anyone help me? Is there any recourse available to someone like me? And if not, why is that?

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: positivity76
title: Podiatry services
body:
My father had multiple health conditions but was seen by podiatry initially at Gransha but then got moved to Altnagelvin hospital out patients (this worked better for us anyway)  
The podiatrist was phenomenal, he knew there was a problem with my father's toe and he made it 'his project' to get to the bottom of what was going on. I couldn't be more thankful that he did this as he went down the route of dermatology, there he was diagnosed with melanoma and is now keeping in contact with us until the toe is removed and scheduling review appointments to ensure that everything heals the way it should.  
From podiatry to dermatology, the nurses and doctors who did biopsies, the cancer nurse, everyone involved, thanks so so much for everything

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: asbo
title: CGL Wisbech
body:
I have been a long term addict, mostly Heroin and crack, I have been with many drug services over the years both in Warwickshire and Wisbech.  
I am finally clean of all illicit substances and am now off script thanks to CGL and am also Hep C free - hooray!!! Thanks Katie - you're amazing  
I am so grateful for the support I have received from my keyworkers, formerly Larraine, Frances and my current worker Andrea who has been amazing, I also want to thank George, who I know prints scripts but she took time out to help and talk to me when I needed it and my keyworker wasn't available.  
I recently experienced a very low time having to escape an abusive relationship and physical assault resulting in fractures to my skull, I was at my lowest ever ebb, I would be dead now if it wasn't for you guys, I cant thank you enough

readBy.name: University of Stirling, Faculty of Social Sciences

author: Portnahaven
title: My mother’s care
body:
My mother was admitted recently to QEUH by ambulance. She had been suffering from a urine infection which the GP had suspected has made her septic. Eventually, she was admitted to ARU5 around 8pm and due to the pandemic we were not allowed to be with her- she has a failing cochlear implant and is almost deaf so lip reads which is challenging as staff wear masks. She is 85 years old. The family were concerned and anxious to hear news so I was nominated as the spokes person and called the unit.  
The first thing which struck me was the numerous times I had to call before someone answered the phone and the nurses never identified who they were but each one calls themselves “staff nurse” I believe it is good manners to identify yourself as I did on the occasions when I called. When I asked how my mum was I was advised that I could only be given limited information due to confidentiality and the doctor was still to see her despite being reviewed in A&E and SATTA. I asked to speak to the person in charge- who said he was the Charge Nurse- again no name however, he was far more helpful and empathetic.  
When someone you love dearly has been taken to hospital, particularly during this pandemic, the patient and family are anxious and upset. I am my mother’s advocate and voice at a time when she has none. I have read that each day an elderly patient remains in hospital a day adds a year to their life. I did not ask the nursing staff for specific details but I did want to know what was wrong and what was her treatment. I was not offered any communication with her although I did ask about the use of an iPad to face time and was advised to call back the following day.  
I thought the NHS motto was “Be Kind” I ask for compassion for my mother a basic attribute for all nurses.

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

author: Ben62
title: Phlebotomy staff member made me cry
body: I have a telephone appointment with Dr Al-Jehani at clinical haematology and I needed to have a blood test prior to my appointment. I checked on my phone and saw that the phlebotomy department opened until 7. 30pm. I arrived at the department at just before 5 o'clock due to lots of traffic. I had to get the bus and was very anxious as I’ve been shielding as I have COPD and a care for my severely disabled daughter. this is the first time I’ve got the bus since March last year. The department was locked. Another patient was coming out with a staff member behind them I asked why it was shut? The staff member was so rude to me in response, I felt really upset. They then told me to go to A& E they can do it. As I walked away the last patient who was leaving said to me that they should not have spoken to me like that it was rude abrupt and unnecessary. I was so upset. I walked round to A& E and was told there was no way they could do my blood test. I just felt very anxious upset and I cried all the way home on the bus. I can’t face going back again and I have emailed my consultant to reschedule my appointment. I feel so let down by my experience and totally demoralised by the whole thing.

author: Batty56
title: A Colonoscopy
body: I turned up for appointment an absolute wreck with nerves, l was greeted by a lovely nurse called Sharon she was so caring and understood my fears. My colonoscopy was carried out by Dr Fortun Consultant Gastroenterologist who was kind and sympathetic to my nerves. The procedure was carried out and at all times l felt l was in excellent hands and was kept comfortable by his lovely staff. After my colonoscopy was done l was taken to recovery where Tim looked after me so well he even took me to my car when l left bless. I can’t praise you all at the endoscopy unit at Treliske Hospital Truro enough you were brilliant. Hope the chocolate bars went down well. Kindest regards.

author: lovebt63
title: Positive GP experience
body: As a patient of Dr. Thompson for a few years I have valued his patient centred approach in any consultation however in particular his manner, understanding and reassurance when reaching out to him in support of ill mental health has been very comforting. I'm so grateful for his balance of encouragement in my improvement as well as ensuring I wasn't rushing to return to work too soon. He always took into consideration my opinion and requests for management of my anxiety and us both agreeing on suitable treatment. Dr. Thompson is a credit to the practice and NHS....Thank you!

author: BMSI
title: Covid Vaccination
body:
I emailed and they said just come in. I pretty much just walked in. I'm nervous and might not have waited if I'd had to wait. Nurses were very nice and very patient.
They were very clear about the information they gave, I didn't ask any questions and I liked that they didn't rush me and having a second person there helped a lot.
I could not have improved anything. I probably won't be too scared to come back and I had been putting it off.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

title: Level of Care
body:
I attended here for the first time yesterday. 
Reception was considerate to the privacy of my information and my waiting time was minimal. 
The nurse who examined me was very softly spoken and put me at ease straight away. 
She explained I would need a referral to Warrington and again was supportive and caring. 
Great staff and environment, even down to the temperature of the examination room.
Parking was easy and I was very grateful that it was free as I had rushed out of work and had no money.

title: Good Experience
body:
Everyone very helpful, practice well organised.
Information given and explained. In and out for COVID jab in 15 mins

title: Friendly, efficient, professional service
body: As a new patient I received a friendly welcome to the practice and a highly professional health check from a most helpful practitioner.

title: Efficient Vaccination process
body:
Informed by both email and letter. through that booked an appointment, on line, with ease.
Had reminder txts also.
Attended 10 mins before expecting a que but waited only a few minutes and joined a short line of people also awaiting.
I was through in 5 minutes with clear information and direction by very helpful volunteers and staff.
Thank you

title: Covid Vaccination
body: I have to say very well Organised and professional from parking every step of the way was quick and efficient. Just like to say Thankyou to all involved your doing a very good and efficient job. Well done all.👏👏👏

title: Vaccinations
body: I would like to thank the practice and staff for the swift & highly efficient way in which they have carried out both the Flu and Covid vaccinations. I was most impressed with the well organised, efficient & safe way in which they handled these. It is much appreciated.

title: Excellent service
body:
My thanks to the doctor who diagnosed the condition and the 2 nurses that carried out the procedure.
Wasn’t expecting a minor op when I went in but treatment was pain free and thank you for the NHS.
Also praise for the lady who was being run ragged at the entrance trying to find seats for arriving patients where there was a shortage due to COVID distancing.

readBy.name: East Kent Hospitals University NHS Foundation Trust

title: Wonderful staff and care
body: Thank you so much to the health centre staff - they’re providing a fantastic vaccine service. I felt safe and cared for. The appointment was quick and stress-free. Would recommend in a heartbeat.

title: Absolutely superb brilliant practice
body: I had a telephone appointment with one of the doctors i spoke to him, he asked me to come to the surgery which i did so. He rang GWH and asked me to go there right away they were brilliant and sorted me out immediately fantastic surgery i got 10 star service can't thank them enough they went the extra mile for me thanks for your help

title: Fantastic service
body: Absolutely fantastic service all round. The Staff at Kirkburton Doctors are always great. They make you feel welcome and comfortable and give you confidence in all aspects of your situations. I would recommend Kirkburton Doctors to anyone wanting a doctor. Thank you for all your help and support received

title: Friendly and efficient
body: Covid safe environment, friendly reception staff, short waiting time and examined in a relaxed and professional manner. No issues.

title: Coronavirus Vaccine
body: Very well organised, very polite, very efficient, very clear procedure, in and out in less than 10 minutes

title: Ecxellent
body: Just to say how brilliantly organised you all were when administering the Covid 19 vaccination. It was very reassuring for anyone who may have been nervous, and everyone was really helpful and friendly. Please ensure everyone involved gets a pat on the back.

title: suspected heart attack
body:
I wish to thank all the medical and nursing staff for their kindness and friendliness. They work in a busy department with some difficult situations, I found their attitude reassuring and friendly. 
well done to all concerned
 THANK YOU

title: Descent practice
body:
I went for my covid vaccine yesterday (9th March) very quick & efficient.
I waited away from the surgery until 5 minutes before my appointment, so I was due in at 15.50 the lady who stood in front of me was due after me but she was let in as she was waiting. But that was fine as we both got in within seconds of each other.

title: Brilliant place
body: Had minor surgery in January 2021 on hand/finger.  Excellent staff.. prompt..efficient. very clean..cant fault them ..emailed them few weeks later regarding another issue I thought was connected.  Had appointment following week. .explained was different issue...had minor surgery again 2 weeks later on 9th March.  Met with same proficiency and same excellence of staff...had good and humourus chat during surgery with nurse and surgeon who also talked me through procedure. .highly recommended..100% .

title: Excellent patient manner
body:
I recently had an appointment at Sternhall Lane Surgery for a diabetic review and for a smear test.

I wanted to praise the 2 staff who did these. I was very nervous, even for the simple diabetic review, as I have been diabetic for over 25 years and have had various good and bad experiences with medical staff (at GPs, hospitals and dentists). I was nervous and mumbling a little, talking about some of the previous experiences and the woman who did this review was very kind, patient and polite. She was truly a wonderful example of medical staff who have excellent patient manner.

The woman who did the smear test was also very helpful and explained everything to me.

I left feeling calm and relaxed! I'm very happy to be a patient with this GP practice.

title: Outstanding care and professionalism
body:
I have recently spent time in St Mary's Hospital in Newport Isle of Wight for surgery.
The dedicated and caring attention from all of the ward staff on Mottistone ward, as well as the professionalism of the surgical team was outstanding. Thank you so much.

title: Thank you
body: Thank you for looking after my mum she moved back to Didsbury from Radcliffe and has nothing but love and attention by you all at Barlow moor medical. I knew this as I used to work for you as a district nurse and knew my mum would be in safe hands thank you all.

title: Helpful and thorough
body:
I have not actually seen a doctor or visited the surgery for months, pre-lockdown in fact.   When I did go to the surgery, I received good, reassuring attention regarding a suspected clot in  my leg.   I was pre-diabetic, and the clinician was encouraging and the booklets very helpful  and well set out.
Since lockdown, the nurse has come to my home for blood tests arranged by the surgery, and there has been a thorough follow-up to YDH specialist visits relating to TIA in January, and glaucoma emergency in February.   
The surgery pharmacist has been very helpful in addressing my problems with administering drugs and drops, due to arthritic fingers, and the confusion following the TIA.
Telephoning has become much quicker and easier -  so grateful for that!

title: Wonderful Nurse!
body:
I am terrified of having blood tests and needles, but the nurse who took my blood at Tilehurst Village surgery was amazing. She made it the best experience it could possibly be under the circumstances. Thank you for putting up with a difficult patient.
These people need a pay rise!

title: Good practice
body: the online service is amazing, you can review all your details. i needed a prescription and it all went smoothly and quick.

title: Outstanding
body: From the nurses who where willing to stay late after a mix up in the phlebotomy dept with my blood sample to the surgeon who performed my extraction the treatment I received was impeccable.

readBy.name: Wirral University Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great Practice
body: I have over the years used a number of GP clinics and I can honestly say that Lavender Hill Group Practice is the best clinic I have tried. The doctors are not afraid to take extra time if they feel it is needed and are generally really thorough. Hope I never have to leave this clinic!

title: Very well looked after
body: I had a total knee replacement which was arranged very quickly. I would like to pass on my thanks to all staff, from pre-assessment to physio , for the wonderful care I received. Nothing was too much trouble. Much appreciated

title: Supportive practice
body:
I have been a patient of Lavender Hill Group Practice for over 20 years and continue to find them helpful, informative and pleasant to deal with.
Their support over the years for an ongoing autoimmune condition and when I went through cancer was and remains faultless.  
I was impressed enough that, when my brother and sister-in-law moved into the catchment area, I had no hesitation in recommending LHGP.

title: Excellent service
body: Thank you for your hard work during these difficult times.  I have liaised with two GPs and had to have a few tests, and they have been organised and helpful.

title: Good service
body:
Efficient booking and communication 
COVID secure
Good advice on the steps to take to help resolve the issue and prevent further problems.

title: Brilliant service
body: All staff and Doctors very caring, approachable and come with excellent knowledge and understanding. Always able to get either an appointment or telephone consultation. Prescription requests are very quick. Really like that the practice undertakes  many trainee Doctors to support their training development. The surgery also has a dedicated staff member to support Care Homes, making things clear and easy to get the support needed.

title: Great staff
body: I was treated promptly. The experience felt safe with good COVID-19 precautions in place . The HCA and advanced Nurse practitioner were professional , kind and kept me calm and the whole process was less painful than I thought it would be. Despite being near the end of their shift they did not rush things and gave me the time I needed to feel confident to leave. Phoning 111 however was a waste of time as the time it took to get through was far too long and giving the many details they asked for, pointless as they are not forwarded to the urgent care centre.

readBy.name: Lincolnshire Community Health Services NHS Trust

title: Amazing Service
body:
Had surgery to repair my right hernia on 24th Feb 2021. The whole process of arranging hospital appointments and follow-up messages was extremely efficient. All the staff who looked after me during this process were fantastic - I want to single out in particular -  all the staff working within the Surgical Centre, all Theatre Staff ( including the Consultant ), Anesthetists, the Recovery Unit team and all those people working on Ward 15A. Everyone was so very professional, knowledgeable, patient, helpful and very caring and understood all my wants and needs. Nothing was too much trouble. You are all amazing and provide a brilliant service.

This is a really great hospital and thank you all so very much for the service that you provided for me. Much appreciated.

readBy.name: Blackpool Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great experience
body: Corona virus vaccine - all very efficient and staff pleasant. Everything was on time, well communicated. Literature was useful and relevant and I was very reassured and well taken care of

title: What A Team!
body:
I had a full hip replacement in February 2021 and was really pleased to be able to have it at the Montefiore.
I had heard about their brilliant team from a friend who had had a very successful double hip replacement at the hospital. I was very keen to have the minimally invasive surgery they offer, and not have a general anaesthetic, but a spinal injection and sedation. I was fully informed of every step and knew what was happening at all times. The spinal injection was nothing to fear, only slightly uncomfortable. That, and the sedation, was carried out by the team in a really relaxed and friendly atmosphere. I chatted during the pre op preps, and almost forgot I was about to have the actual procedure. I was asleep and unaware throughout the operation which took just over an hour. 
No general anaesthetic meant no fuzziness coming round and nothing lingering in my system; a good kick start for recovery. I was able to weight bear the same day which also boosted my confidence . 
My wound was very small and is now a 6" line scar. I had no bruising at all, and the stitches were all the dissolving kind, so no removal required. All very neat and clean.
It is lovely to be free of pain, to be able to sleep comfortably again and to have so much more energy. There is lots to look forward to and enjoy again and I feel years younger!
I have no hesitation in recommending the wonderful hip team at the Montefiore. Their brilliant way of replacing hips means a much faster and more comfortable recovery. I feel lucky and privileged to have benefited from the skills of this top class team.

title: Great Nursing Team
body: I have recently been diagnosed with diabetes , I had an appt with the nurse at tilbury, I would just like to pass on my thanks to the nurse for taking the time to explain to me all about my diabetes up until now I was a bit confused with it all to be honest , in my opinion the lady is a true asset to your surgery she was very thorough took time to explain all about diabetes and listened to me and my questions and answered all of them for me  , and I came away from the surgery like a huge weight had been lifted of my shoulders.

title: Fantastic service
body: I had to go to A&E at midnight on Saturday 6 March. The service was smooth from the moment I arrived and my treatment in the minors dept was fantastic.  I really wish I could remember the nurses name ..it begin with an S and he is, I believe, a locum. He was so thorough, knowledgeable, patient & kind and nothing was too much trouble. I came away feeling so much better and knew what the next step would be. Thank you!

author: kmhb123
title: Working Age Dementia Carers Group
body: I have been part of this online group now for a few weeks and it has been great to be able to talk with others in similar situations and to also have support from the group leader who organises the sessions.   We have been able to share our problems, strategies for dealing with difficult situations and have access to support, alongside creating a good bond together for the future.   It is essential that carers who are looking after someone with dementia have time out for themselves - it is such a complex and stressful caring role which can be over a very long period of time and take it's toll.   It is a good place to be able to check in, have a moan, groan, cry or laugh because we don't always have the escape routes to do that. Thank you for the WAD team for setting this up for us!

author: tmaster77
title: Anxiety. Reacting to quickly.
body:
I ask Inclusion for help and some advice.  
After more than 19 sessions I was able to get my anxiety down. I learned a lot about my self. Thanks to Janice I managed to overcome so many problems I had during a very hard time in my life.  
I will always be grateful to Janice for all the help I got. She listened to me and gave me some good feedback to help me overcome my issues.  
I want to say thank you so much for your support and help.

author: Labrador_
title: Covid vaccination
body:
I was told we could get a staff vaccine. Staff member contacted the clinic, simple and effective.
Clinic easy to find, I arrived early but came straight through, really nice welcome and quickly 'processed'
Was given enough info and I could ask questions but I had none.
Nothing could be improved, all fine.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: Casper_
title: Covid vaccination
body: I was phoned and told date and time. Very clearly signed all the way. 1st gentlemen was very polite, arrangements for the consent form was brilliant. Nurse was efficient and good. I was asked if I had any questions, but I didn't.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: Trina10
title: Mole removal
body:
Attended Forth Valley Hospital today to have a mole removed on my arm. I was feeling nervous about the procedure but was put at ease straight away after meeting Kirsty and Lee-Ann. They were both extremely friendly, Lee-Ann did a great job keeping me distracted while Kirsty removed the mole.  
Kirsty explained the procedure and aftercare with me before starting. Kirsty was extremely gentle and took care, it didn't take long and I was not in pain or discomfort.  
Would also like to mention how safe I felt attending my appointment today, the covid safety controls in place and pre examination meeting with Kirsty made me feel very safe. I am extremely grateful to all the NHS employees who have been working hard during the difficult times of the covid pandemic. Thank you.

readBy.name: MASScot- Melanoma Action and Support Scotland
